posts.post_content:
Carl Critchlow made a splendid artwork for that card, but that's the only good thing about it regrettably.  
Five mana *and* a creature which *even* has to be a fatty in order to bring down a big thread? No, thanks...  
They should have made the cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), then it would have been a black, slightly more efficient Arcane version of [Fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fling) for creatures only.

posts.post_content:
The absolute most ideal circumstance for this would be getting rid of a Ball Lightning or similar creature before it dies. It has huge power for its cost and it's going to die anyway. That's the absolute best-case scenario.  
  
AND THE CARD STILL SUCKS! Even under laughably idealized conditions, it's still horrendously overpriced!

posts.post_content:
As an instant, the real best case scenario is response to removal or creature steal, but three or even four mana would be more fair. As is, i'd rather just cast [Momentous Fall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentous Fall).  
This was probably originally an uncommon board wipe card along the likes of [Kagemaro, first to suffer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kagemaro, first to suffer), and a sorcery. And they forgot to change the mana cost.
